Reviews.Title: “More Pros than Cons, but......”
Reviews.Author: Tomlin2232
Reviews.Content: My aunt traded her time share for this, so we could be close to Disney. Pros....it is very close to all the parks; can save on meals by eating breakfast and packing lunches (the parks allowed us to bring them in), the water park area is great with good activities for the kids, fitness center nice, pleasant staff. Cons.....main negative is that not all the units have been upgraded and we got one that wasn't. It was clean, but very dated. The sofa bed is useful only for small children. The mattress was thin and had no support, so my husband and I had to put it on the floor each night and sleep there. We also had to ask for an extra pillow (the unit had 5 for 6 people) and there were only sheets for the sofa bed, so check early if you need an extra blanket or pillow. We had ants on one section of the kitchen counter, so had to move all the food up and out of the way and be sure that nothing was left out when we were gone. Would have thought that since this was a time share trade (place was not full) that they would have given us an upgraded unit. BE SURE TO ASK FOR ONE !!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Tanya E
Reviews.Content: We were expecting more from this resort. The unit was quite small and dated but clean and pleasant. The screened in porch had a floor made of loose rocks - painful and messy. The pull out couch was horrible! Encountered 2 extremely rude front desk employees. Other staff that we encountered did respond quickly to requests. We enjoyed the pool area - lazy river and slides were fun. We were visiting Disney and we felt that the free shuttle to attractions was poor. It only went to Epcot which meant changing buses to get to other resorts. The earliest departure time was 8:45 am which meant that for any park but Epcot, we missed park opening. It was also extremely late for pick up one day. A word of warning if you go - do not use the transportation company (taxi) recommended by the resort. They overcharge and are unreliable.

Reviews.Title: “March Break”
Reviews.Author: pademo57
Reviews.Content: When we first pulled up I wasn't sure what to expect. The place seemed tired on the outside. However, the staff that greeted us were very upbeat and were very efficient. The condo itself was very clean and a nice size especially for a family of four. The kitchen was spotless. However, there were some ants crawling over the kitchen bar. But being in a "tropical" location I wasn't that worried. There was a full size refrigerator, glass top stove, microwave and dishwasher. The pots and pans were all nicely cleaned. Some of the utensils needed some cleaning but that's what a dishwasher is for! The rooms upstairs included a master bedroom with a queen size bed. The other bedroom had two twin beds which my kids loved especially because they had their own TV. The upstairs also had a stacked washer and dryer, though a bit noisy it still did the job none the less. There were two bathrooms one upstairs and one downstairs. The only complaint about the condo we stayed in was there wasn't a closet on the main floor to hang up coats and whatever else we didn't want to drag upstairs. They provided transportation to Walt Disney World. The bus will pick you up at 8:45am and after stopping at other hotels drop you off at Epcot parking lot. The only problem is that they won't pick you up until after 6pm. So plan accordingly especially if it is a hot one with little ones in tow. The pool amenities were for the most part great. For some reason on our first day the water slides were shut down and there was no around that could give us a reason. On the second day everything was open and working fine. The lazy river was a nice way to relax and the zero entry pool was a huge hit with my kids. They also have an area which has an air hockey table, basketball shooting game as well as video games. However, to play them you have to "buy" a card which would be used to swipe a game so you could "play". At the time we went, a $1.00 would buy you 4 plays but some of the games would cost 3 plays per game, so unless you were a wiz at math you ended up with a card that had 1 or 2 plays left. A bit chintzy I thought. Unfortunately, we had to leave early because a family member back home was given 48 hours to live. The staff was tremendous in helping us with trying to get back home early. Would I stay there again? Most definitely!

Reviews.Title: “Fantasy World Club”
Reviews.Author: 2j2l1s
Reviews.Content: The pool at this resort is amazing. The children in my party, ages 17,14,12,6,and 4, all had a blast. The villas were a little smaller that I had expected, but they were clean and well stocked. The "queen" bed in the master bedroom was actually two twins pushed together. Therefore, the middle of the bed was a very hard board. It made sleeping uncomfortable. When I complained about this at checkout, the clerk replied that all the queen beds were like that. With different beds, this could be a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Andrea C
Reviews.Content: Room was not exactly as pictured, but provided enough room for me and my two kids ( ages 6 and 16). No housekeeping of any kind. Plenty of clean towels provided for our 8-day stay. Checked for bedbugs and none found. Wish mattresses had been covered. Pillows were lumpy so bring your own. We did not use the dishwasher because it had water in it so did not use. Plenty of dishes, pots, forks spoons and plates were provided. However, the note on one of the cupboards that these were not cleaned by sanitation code made me not use them. Instead, we used disposable utensils, cups and plates. Sanitized pots by boiling hot water. Did not like crawling ants or whatever they were on kitchen counter. Was not amused by the extra company (HUGE roaches). We left all lights on at night. Heat did not work. Did not use washer & dryer so I can't say if they worked. Close to all major theme parks and super walmart is a 5 minute drive. If you do not have a car, it's a walk to the supermarket. NOT across the street. It was very dark at night so trash had to be thrown out ( dumpster) before dark or in the morning. Front desk (Dominga) was friendly. Pool was nice. You pay for what you get. Will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the price”
Reviews.Author: ONichols
Reviews.Content: Place was good size for a family of 4. The downstairs shower in the unit we stayed in was aweful unless you like to be attacked by the water and it came out so HARD and the area was very small. The furniture was outdated maybe like early 80's type style. As for the kitchen great size but we are on vacation so did not use to much.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, lovely event”
Reviews.Author: FLClaudia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Fantasy World Resort the 3rd week in March. It was spring break for my family and I was also hosting a baby shower for my sister. We chose this resort because of the great location and amenities for our shower guests and their families, who were coming from all over Florida. The condo was very clean and the kitchen was immaculate. We liked the tropical themed furnishings and décor in dark reds, golds, and greens—all of which were in excellent condition. The full kitchen featured granite countertops and stainless steel oven, refrigerator, microwave, and dishwasher. There’s even a garbage disposal. The small appliances include blender, toaster, and coffee maker. As an avid cook, I really appreciated the full set of knives, including steak knives. All the pots and pans were in good shape and there were other necessities, such as a glass measuring cup and measuring spoons and a cookie sheet, in case you get the urge to bake. There was also a bottle opener and corkscrew. Dish cloths, towels, dish soap and dishwasher detergent were provided. The condo had an efficient layout with a full bathroom with walk-in shower (with hand rail) downstairs, and a full bathroom with tub upstairs. The master bedroom had a very comfortable bed. The pillows were so fluffy that we slept on one each, instead of our usual 2 each. The closet had a very cool built in storage system that I will keep in mind for my own home. It has space for hanging clothes on each side, a dresser in the middle with plenty of drawers, and a flat screen TV on top. There’s a safe inside the closet and shelving above. The second bedroom had 2 comfy twin beds. The double dresser is outside the closet. There is a flat screen TV. It was spacious and clean. Both bedrooms had ceiling fans, wooden blinds, sheer curtains, and blackout curtains that really work. As a light sleeper, I appreciated that it was quiet at night. There is a sunny screened porch with a chaise, and table and chairs. The pool towels are located inside the living room TV cabinet. You can clean them in the washer and dryer upstairs. The pool area is amazing. It was one of the big draws for us. It features a zero entry pool, lazy river, splash area for the small kids and 2 serious water slides. The kids were in heaven, and we had lots of fun too. There are cool activities all day long, such as tie-dying shirts, crafts, and games. We had lunch delivered at the pool one day (ordered at the bar). There’s a good variety on the menu and everyone was pleased. They have cabanas for rent that are very reasonable and can include food, drink and a flat screened TV. Some of the dads and kids hung out in the cabana while the ladies had the baby shower. We held the baby shower in the meeting room of the resort, overlooking the pool. It was wonderful working with John Rowland, the food and beverage manager. He went out of his way to make our event a lovely success. He even prepared a delicious and beautiful peach sangria for the shower, which was a huge hit. We really appreciated his hard work, attention to detail, and desire to please. We did spend some time visiting area attractions, which were all very close. Our son especially enjoyed the Medieval Times dinner theatre. They regularly send a knight in full costume to the resort to give away coupons. He also “knights” the children. They love it! The resort provides shuttles to the theme parks and outlet malls, but we used our own car. There are restaurants within walking distance. A Publix grocery store, pharmacy and Sam’s Club are very close. On our last day, we loaded the car and checked out of the room. Then we spent one more morning at the pool before heading home. The resort accommodates this by offering lockers and showers near the pool. I thought this was very clever. We all had a great time. It was a fun way for all the families to get together and enjoy each other in a relaxing atmosphere with all the comforts of home. We will definitely go back to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, beware hidden extra pool costs/surf machine costs.”
Reviews.Author: shineyy
Reviews.Content: I looked hard for a place to stay on a 2 week trip from the UK as a single father with 3 daughters and this place seemed to match the requirements. Good proximity to all parks, shopping (massive Wal mart 5 mins to the rear), dining. Airport. All good. When we arrived (easy to find) The check in was easy (after a long flight much appreciated) The villa we had was immaculate, and had everything we need for a family. Well equipped kitchen, dishwasher, Large fridge freezer. everything we needed and more. I use the gym every day and the facilities were adequate and up to date. Very good. Pros...Clean. safe, Quiet. Very polite and helpful staff. Great pool, Cons. Had to pay an extra $162 to use the pool for 2 weeks:( Apparently it`s in the small print but myself, the management and my travel agent can`t find it so it`s an ongoing issue to resolve upon my return to the UK . The surf machine is an extra as well which i found a little misleading. Oh and there are no instructions to use the oven. I contacted house keeping twice and they never came around to show me when they said they would, small point but a pain none the less. Overall.... i would reccomend this place to friends to stay and possibly would stay again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: CinJay
Reviews.Content: I rented this place for our first Disney World trip and was not disappointed. The rooms are clean and spacious. Full sized fridge, stove and dishwasher. Compact washer and dryer. The only thing I would have to say was not great was the decor, think 1970's. If you can get past that then you will have just as wonderful stay as I did.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool - Average Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: spike2010_10
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from spending a week at this resort. Our group consisted of 4 adults and my 2 1/2 year old grandson. Overall, we were quite pleased with the resort. We arrived late in the evening, so check-in was quick and easy. The young fellow at the front desk was friendly and helpful. The front desk and reception area could use some organization and straightening up, as it is your first impression of the facility, but it's no big deal. The pool/recreation area is fabulous. There are plenly of chairs, cabanas, etc. There is also a games room, business center, workout facility and simulated golf area. After having read some of the other reviews, I had requested an updated unit close to the pool so it would be easier for us with our young grandson. Our unit was located right accross from the pool area. The location was great! The unit intself was acceptable and clean. Although I was told that it had been updated, it was still somewhat dated. The quality of workmanship is average, at best. Overall, it worked out ok. Our unit had 2 bedrooms. One bedroom had a queen bed and the other had 2 singles - both are on the second floor. The mainfloor has a pullout couch/sofabed. The sofa bed was impossible for anyone to sleep on comfortably. Needless to say, this arrangement did not work perfectly for our group. We ended up having to move the mattress from the sofa bed to one of the upstairs bedrooms and place it on the floor so my grandson could sleep. The resort does not offer any portable beds/cots. The only other issue, albeit a minor one, was the screened in porch area. The screen were ripped in a few spots. The access is through the patio door, which did not open/close very easily. Also, the porch area had an old small table, 2 chairs and a lounger. We noticed that some of the other units had a larger patio table and 4 chairs. We called the front desk to inquire if we could have something similar and were told no. However, these were just a few minor inconveniences. We did call about a broken latch on the porch door and a couple of other minor things - towels, etc. and they responded quickly. The resort is quite conveniently located and the pool area made up for some of the other issues. There are plently of restaurants within close driving distance to the resort. Overall, we were quite satisfied with the experience and would seriously consider returning. If they upgraded their sofa bed and a few of the minor issues, this would have been an even nicer experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and awesome pool area”
Reviews.Author: motherofthree
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with Fantasy World after reading mixed reviews prior to arriving. The villas were perfect for our family of five. The pool/waterpark was amazing. Bar had happy hour specials everyday. All of the staff we encountered were friendly. We stayed in the Wet and Wild court which was close to the pool. Their are many eating and shopping places in the area which are just a couple minutes drive away from the resort. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: electricity0
Reviews.Content: fantastic place great for families class organization you will not be disappointed could write about everything but no worries if you go

Reviews.Title: “Good family friendly option. Fun pools.”
Reviews.Author: Carrie M
Reviews.Content: We got an updated condo near the back in Rosie O'Grady court. It was identical to the pictures on the web. It was clean, quiet, and we felt safe. There was a nice grass area behind the condo where our kids got to run around while we were hanging out on the patio. The only complaints that I have are that 1) the kitchen isn't well stocked for cooking, and 2) the washing machine was crazy loud. All things considered, I would totally stay here again, I'll just bring my own salt and pepper.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for what you get!”
Reviews.Author: Shanon W
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights and it worked for the 4 people we had. I feel the beds could be more comfortable and the bathroom door didn't lock (which sucks when you want privacy and my 3 year old barges in and leaves the door open). Also do not leave any food out (sugar ants, which are common in FL and even take over clean homes). Other than those tiny problems we loved it there. They have a nice pool area and tons of things with in a block or 2 radius. They are descent sized villas close to all the parks. Will definatley stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Best place yet!!!”
Reviews.Author: Scott W
Reviews.Content: OK people I read reviews before and after I booked read some bad reviews and also good .Let me say for the people and familys that left bad reviews You must want alot!! or are never pleased we stayed at this resort A1 all the way .Staff were more then willing to help .Great rooms beds were great water park was #1 realy had a great time Thanks Fantasy world we will be back excellent spot .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent spot for families!!!! GREAT water part”
Reviews.Author: Calvin1435
Reviews.Content: We just spent two nights at the Fantasy World Resort. It was fabulous for the price! The water park is new and beautiful... Great Happy Hour drink prices for adults. Game room, computer,access, virtual golfing and surfing for teens. A closed in water park area for toddlers. It is close to shops and a Publix supermarket for stocking up on items. We had a 2 bedroom townhouse that was spacious and comfortable. It was clean bright and fun! Three TV's a screen porch..lots of towels... room service if you need it. I highly recommend this spot... I am returning next year....You can not go wrong. The staff is outstanding! Lisa on the front desk was very nice to deal with... the housekeepers were accommodating with any request and the life guards patient with children... If your going to Orlando area check this place out!

Reviews.Title: “Home from Home”
Reviews.Author: antswfc
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this location 3 times over the last 7 years and everytime it improves. It has now had a complete face lift and is a great place to stay on vacation. The kitchen in the villas is great and well equipped or you could use the new free on site BBQs or just 5 mins walk is some great Restuarants.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful pool area”
Reviews.Author: Saffi_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one week. The villas are very cute on the outside and very spacious. We stayed on Seaworld Court which was nice but thought that the villa could use some updating. Kitchen was nicely set up and beds were comfy. We were a little surprised that they did not provide housekeeping but we probably didn't read the fine print. If you required new pool towels they charged $9.00, also a $5.00 fee if you needed your door card replaced which I thought was a little petty and thought the extra $80.00 fee for the week was a little steep, not sure what this was for if you didn't even get housekeeping. Would probably return but would request a villa that was newer. It was nice having a washer/dryer and location was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful family resort!”
Reviews.Author: Bernadette38
Reviews.Content: Condos were spacious, well appointed and clean. The resort was recently remodeled, so posts saying it is old are probably prior. Loved having the W/D in the unit. Kids could have spent half the trip at the resort... The pool area is clean with a great lazy river, hot tubs and water slides; pool temp was perfect too. Only wished there were a restaurant on site. Food could be ordered but not a huge selection. Lots of stores and restaurants nearby. Within 10 min of parks. We will definitely go back with kids. Maybe not the choice for a romance getaway as its mainly families.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort especially with Kids...highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: gs_and_ss
Reviews.Content: This resort really is a hidden gem. They just spent 6 million on a total update and addition of a water park and it really shows. The condos are newlrefurbisheded and are quiet comfortable. Ours had a large kitchen with marblcounter topsps and stainless steeapplianceses, a dining room, good sized den with large screen TV, an outdoor screened in porch with table and chairs and a lounge chair, two very nice bedrooms both with new flat screen TV's and two large bathrooms. Then we get to the really impressive part of this resort. They just built an activities building with a nicely stocexercisecise room, sauna, steam room, kids areas, conference rooms, a virtual golf practice area and game room. The center also had free shuttles to all the major parks so don'tdont have to drive or pay the huge parking fees. Then the water park. A very nice zero slope pool, a lazy river, two water slides, a kids splash area and a warm tub as well as a hot tub! The kids can stay busy all day while mom & dad relax. There is also an adjoining surf attraction next door where you can ride the waves or just have fun watching. For the adults the pool has cabana's with coolers and big screen TVs....heavenly. Also a beautiful outdoor pool bar was great and had good food and big screen TV's. All this with a great location just a couple of miles from Disney and Old Town and many nice restaurants in the area, some within easy walking distance. This resort has someeveryoneor everone and I highly recommend it to couples or families alike.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jenny5612
Reviews.Content: I have been to Orlando many many times and this is the first time I stayed here. It was great. My 19 & 14 year old sons love it. Pool area is fun and great for any age. Activity center was a hit with them. Also included were 2 tickets to Fantasy Surf - my kids had a blast. It was conveniently located to the parks. Rooms were clean. Only complaint I have is that the TVs were outdated, but we didn't spend much time in the room anyway. Highly recommend this place especially if you have teenagers.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean condo”
Reviews.Author: maoflandr
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Fantasy World the past 6 winters. We have found each condo to be clean and well equipped for a rental. If something is missing or not working properly, a quick call to the front desk has solved the problem promptly. Each year we have been here we see the management upgrading the condos. This current year they have added a beautiful water park. The property is not a fancy tropical "resort" but it has provided us with the basic comforts we want in a rental. The front desk has been very accommodating to any request and the location is excellent with several restaurants within walking distance and a good grocery store nearby. A shuttle is available to the Disney area and also a nearby shopping mall. What else can one need?

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, but otherwise just ok”
Reviews.Author: dibSlc
Reviews.Content: The good: Convenient to the Parks. Great pool and amenities, playground, bar, pool, arcade games. Great price. The bad: horribly cheap, uncomfortable beds, stinky sulpher water, not as clean as I would expect. Dusty, and long black hairs on my linens. Wear a hair net people! Also, the slides are not for the faint at heart. Never been on one as fast as the yellow one. Too scary for kids under about 10.

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving in Fantasy World”
Reviews.Author: K S
Reviews.Content: Headed to Fantasy World for Thanksgiving and had a great time! Were thrilled with the beautiful new pools, covered lounging beds by the pool and workout center! Close to everything and well maintained...would recommend and will return!

Reviews.Title: “Christmas in Florida”
Reviews.Author: Lisa S
Reviews.Content: My husband & I and our three children, ages 16, 15 and 9 just spent 10 nights at Fantasy World. It was our first Christmas away from home and our experience there was fabulous! Loved that it was decorated for the Holiday, and enjoyed listening to the Christmas songs continue even after Christmas day. Even though the villa we stayed in could use a little up dating, it was perfect for us. If there was any problems, they were on top of it and fixed it right away. The pool, lazy river, gym, arcade and tennis court was awesome!They offered activities throughout the day for all to enjoy. Enjoyed our lunches at the out door bar area, the bartender made us feel welcome and comfortable. Loved the fact that after spending a full day at the overly crowed amusement park, that it was the opposite back at Fantasy World Resort and we could relax at the pool soaking it all in. At the front desk, if there was anything you needed to know, there was a gentlemen that is super nice and made sure you were being taking care of. On Christmas eve I took the kids for a walk around the grounds getting some fabulous shots and especially loved that they offered a Christmas tree for pictures also. Almost any kind of shopping or restaurants are near by as well as the amusement parks. We would recommend this villa resort to our friends. Thanks for making our Holiday a special one.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: Sarah_S_12542
Reviews.Content: The room are small. You are crowded walking over each other. The bathroom for 6 people is terrible. The carpet was old and dirty looking. We have to travel past trash bins to get to our unit. There was a cyclone fence in back of our unit. On the other side of the cyclone fence was businesses. Not what you expect to see in sunny Florida. The place was congested and definitely not a comfortable place. It wasn't a place where you could relax. There wasn't any grass in the front or back of my unit. This you would not expect in Florida. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “very nice place to stay i did have proplem with fantasy world resort”
Reviews.Author: magser4
Reviews.Content: very nice place to stay i did have proplem with patio door not opening but somone came the next day to try to fix it not to worried as we were hardly there nice person at the front desk named{ david } i also felt safe there as it was first time in usa will go there again hope this helps

Reviews.Title: “Amazing pool & area attractions”
Reviews.Author: Angela O
Reviews.Content: I would give this resort about 4 1/2 stars even though my comments may sound negative. The overall experience was a lot of fun. The pool, water slides, lazy river, hot tub,gym was amazing!! The location was excellent because it was very close to both Disney World and Universal Studios. Also very close to plenty of restaurants and Publix to pick up groceries. However, once I woke up to cockroaches in the kitchen and living area and on the ceiling, I felt very uncomfortable and was constantly looking around to see where the next one was going to be. I called to report the problem and maintenace did come within a few minutes with some stray. It seem to help or at least put my mind at ease. Check in was a little annoying. We arrived at 4:00, and they said the room would be ready in 10 minutes. So we went out to get come groceries and came back around 5:00 and they were still cleaning our room. Towels were also a pain. Of course since there is no room service, you have to recycle using the towels, but the dryer in our unit never dried the towels, so we always had to use damp ones. We managed by just taking our towels out to the pool and laying them in the sun for a while. Overall, we had a great time which made our mishaps seem insignificant.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag for us, despite other reviews”
Reviews.Author: AnAceBuyer
Reviews.Content: I'm sure the other reviewers had a better experience than we did. As some mentioned, the updates vary on the units. Ours, in the 31xx complex had a serious palmetto bug problem inside. We stayed 4 nights between Xmas and New Years, and killed 5 in the kitchen and living room. Called maintenance the 2nd night, and they came promptly and sprayed, but I kept killing palmettos until our last morning. Lifeguards during the holiday were lax in the AM hours; barely watched the lazy river complex. The lazy river is a nice idea, but there are several areas out of sight of adult observation or supervision, not to mention lifeguards. Strong current, as needed to move the tubes, but was clearly a handful for small kids. Entry point by main pool looks docile enough, but parents of youngsters really need to station themselves on the overpass bridge to keep an eye on the kids, because the lifeguards do not. Kids and adults complained about banging their heads repeatedly in the yellow waterslide, too. Maybe the water volume/speed is too high? Kids avoided using the slide after the first couple of times. Plenty of mosquitos despite dry weather raised plenty of welts as well. Terrible and erratic wi-fi too. Yes, it is free, and yes the signal is strong, BUT the bandwidth is horrible and most applications struggle or fail. (e.g., could't shop Amazon or search w/Google!) There appear to be long-term renters interspersed in the units, sporting Christmas trees, wreaths, wall decorations, bikes, etc. Right off 192, and only a block from restaurants and 3 blocks from a Publix, so it is a convenient location, but police sirens at all hours of the night were disruptive. All in all a mediocre stay. We've had better stays in all respects, including safety, at places like Liki Tiki (incl water park), Marriott Cypress, Grand Beach resort, and others: Minimal or no palmettos or mosquitoes, decent wi-fi, good lifeguarding, and units in better condition. We would stay again as a timeshare trade if there were no other choices, but this would not be our first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing amenities”
Reviews.Author: BeachBound29
Reviews.Content: Rooms are great. Very clean, spacious, and modern. Absolutely floored by the waterpark. Zero entry pool is great for the kids, lazy river, waterslides, jacuzzi's off to the side and in front of a gorgeous stone fireplace, even a kiddie splash area. Bar is really nice too. Can't go wrong staying here, worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Was a great idea but needs some more improvement.”
Reviews.Author: Troy S
Reviews.Content: We recently had a 6 day stay at Fantasy World Villas. We chose this because it was a special on a travel site and seemed like a great value to us. Upon check-in we were given keys to the "room" / villa... one did not work at all. They have magnetic key cards instead of swipers which were sometimes touchy. We arrived after midnight from a long drive and basically just fell in bed. Overall our stay was "fine"... not anything that I would call outstanding or even great really. Our villa included two bedrooms, on with king bed and one with two twins. Our third child slept on the couch. The pull out couch was NOT nice looking so we folded it back up and made him sleep on the couch itself. There were NO linens in the villa for the pullout even if he had WANTED to sleep on it... We had only 4 towels for our family of 5 and had to go to the front desk and request more. The front desk "informed" me that they should be under the TV cabinet. They were not. Let alone if we wanted a set of dry towels for the pool! The TV's were antiquated. Not only were they OLDER model box tv's but they were all less than 19 inches! I know you don't come on vacation to watch to TV but still... even our kids (who are 9,7,5) were instantly like "REALLY?". The linens on all the beds were older and my back hurt almost every night sleeping in the master. The one thing that REALLY got to me though, was the "washer / dryer"... haha... they should not even advertise this as a feature. I believe the tag on ours said it was produced in the late 80's!!! It was SO loud that I was SURE our neighbors complained when I tried to do laundry one night and it literally took running the dryer 4X (4 hours) to dry 4 towels! (which is problematic considering how tight they are with the towels!) I asked someone TWICE at the front desk about getting our washer and dryer looked at and in the 6 days we were there we never saw anyone and the thing never stopped making the horrendous noise. The overall condition of the villa, I would call, run down. You could tell it has been "half-way" renovated.. But what god are granite countertops if the 1980's appliances and cabinets underneath them are crappy? If you are going to renovate... don't be cheap! I had no issue with not having a daily room service... we use a friend's condo in Alabama and we are used to "condo" life of "clean your own mess"... we are FINE with that but there was little, in the way of cleaners, to do so! I went to walmart and bought my own things. I refused to use the dishware provided because the dishwasher barely worked, let alone was able to SANITIZE anything! ACK. The POOL area was phenomenal but the lifeguards were ALWAYS late to open the slides and lazy river, which is an issue for a mom who had kids who get up at 7 am. The pool is supposed to open at 9 or 10 am... but either way it was usually almost 11 am before it really opened. The guards were ALWAYS found slouched in at a table near the base of the slides or smoking.. having been a guard myself in my younger days that would NEVER have been acceptable. There were many towel huts but no towels in them... so why there were there I don't know. The jacuzzi area was BEAUTIFUL!!! The back porch was fine... we didn't really use it but it did make me paranoid that they had TWO bars to lock your sliding doors. Made me wonder if we were in an ok part of town! Also, I wondered why there was no clothes line to hang wet suits from... having been on many a vacation I know those retractable ones exist. Would be a nice addition considering the dryer barely worked! Speaking of security... forget about using the "safe". I have a DSLR camera and it was not big enough to fit it in there... let alone our laptop... The wireless internet was VERY slow even at off hours... The wireless at the pool / main desk area was MUCH better though! Parking was fine for us... we always got the spot RIGHT in front of our villa and our villa was an EASY walk to the pool but they were re-surfacing black top the entire week and had half of the parking closed. I felt bad for those who had to walk 1/2 mile from parking to their villas... :( I could also tell, as we were leaving and the holiday rush was arriving that later in the weekend parking might have been a MAJOR issue. In our "court" people were parked all over the place, in the grass, median, in front of the dumpsters...Overall I was ok with this "hotel" because we spent nearly every waking hour at Disney or the beach ... if we had had to see more of the hotel I would have been upset honestly. It is very centrally located to the main "strip" in Orlando and close to Disney. We usually stay at Nick Hotel and likely will go back there next year. We stayed at a Comfort suites on the drive home and it was 10X nicer than this place... :(

Reviews.Title: “Great Townhouse”
Reviews.Author: Keeblerelf928
Reviews.Content: The two bedroom townhouse gave plenty of space for 4 adults to spread out and have separate sleeping quarters which is a must. We had an updated unit that save for a few issues was in perfect condition. In our townhouse we had 2 bedrooms upstairs with a full large bathroom. One bedroom had a "king" sized bed (two twins pushed together) and the other room had two twin beds. There was also a tiny washer and dryer. Downstairs there was another full bathroom that was a bit on the small side, a large kitchen, living and dining room and a nice screened in porch. It was located within a 10-15 minute drive of all the Disney Parks and within a 20 minute drive of Sea World and Universal Studios. Check in and check out was a breeze. We were able to check in 5 hours early since we had a morning flight in and we check out in less than 2 minutes. The front desk staff was hit and miss on helpfulness. Some of the people we spoke to were great, and others had no interest in helping. For example, we went to grill and the gas grill wasn't working so we called the front desk to ask for help. That person informed us that the directions were there and hung up. After another 10 minutes of trying we called again and the next person sent maintanance out. It turns out the gas was off and we were never going to get it lit without their help. The amenities on property included 3 pools (1 main pool and 2 smaller near other town homes) 2 main Spas and at least one Spa at the smaller pool by our townhome. It also had a water park that included a lazy river and 2 water slides. The tubes they use for the lazy river are too large for the size of the river and constantly got stuck. We had a lot more fun just swimming around without the tubes. The water slides are super fast and if you are the least bit claustrophobic you should not take the yellow slide. The main pool by the small waterpark is heated and the smaller pools did not appear to be heated. We had a blast hanging out at the main pool on our non park days. The only issue that knocked it down a mark was the screens in one of the rooms was completely busted to the point the window could not be opened without risking bugs getting in. When mentioned to maintenance they did nothing to help. The only other issue we had was they decided to repave the parking lot while we were there. They gave us only a few hours warning to move the car and the next parking lot over was nowhere near our townhouse and there was no walkway between that lot and the townhouse. With how few guests they had at the time there was no reason to pave the lot near occupied townhouse. Overall, we would stay here again because we liked having the space and it was close to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “I refuse to stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: Meganbop2
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed here twice now. First time, it was my husband, my mother, my 5 year old son, my 7 month old daughter, and myself. And the second time, same people, three years later and add a new baby! We loved it so much because there was plenty of room for all of us (mom, dad & baby in the room with the queen bed, and grandma and grandkids shared the room with two twin beds). The full size kitchen is perfect when traveling with kids, as they like to snack and it's easy to just keep things in the fridge and use the microwave if needed. Plus, there's a Publix just down the road to pick up food items to make for those late night cravings when restaraunts are closed. The location is great! Close to shopping, restaurants, and less than 20 min from Disney and Universal. If you rent a car, don't prepay for fuel because everything is so close to the resort (unless they give you a Hummer and you're driving to Daytona Beach), it's cheaper to fill the tank on your own. I had very few encounters with the staff, but what little I did have, everyone was very helpful and upbeat. I didn't find anything wrong with not having maid service during out stay. The villa is clean and I've never had a problem with dirty linens or bugs coming into the apartment Or anything yucky at all. The free wi-fi is decent. The gym, pools, sauna, steam room, and arcade, gave all of us something to do if we were having downtime in between trips to the theme parks. I love this place and I have no desire to stay anywhere else when I'm visiting Florida. Great place to bring the family for an amazing price!

Reviews.Title: “Good place for families.”
Reviews.Author: Cambium29
Reviews.Content: The villas are a good place for families who want to spread out and don't want to be bothered with going out to eat everyday, or who want to relax without the hassle of traffic, parking, and crowds. The full kitchens are efficient and include all the basics for cooking and serving meals. The living/dining rooms are large enough to accomodate a family, and the attached fully screen patios are a nice respite from bugs. The bathrooms are adequate, the beds are comfy, a full size stack washer and dryer in each villa is a big plus. The water slide, lazy river, and main pool is new and a popular hang out for vacationers, but there are also two other pools and hot tubs that are rarely used in other locations on the property if you want to avoid the crowds. Gas and charcoal grills are located in various parts of the property. The location is decently located close enough to attractions and restaurants, but away from all the crowds and noise. Shopping is close by. SuperTarget and Wal-Mart are a few miles away, or a Publix grocery store is a quick ten minute walk from the property. Overall, this is a really good place to stay. I only found two annoyances: 1) There were never any towels at the pools. I have a feeling they only put out towels once during the day and when the supply is gone, it's gone until the next day. An inconvenience, but not the end of the world. We simply bought a few and brought our own. 2) As this is a timeshare property, you will be asked to "meet with the manager" or "discuss opportunities" a number of times. I insisted that I was too busy, then unplugged the room phone so as not to be bothered.

Reviews.Title: “Easy and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: barkelbear
Reviews.Content: We arrived on November 1st and the first person we met was Jose (with a J) friendly and easy check in.The 2 bed town house was in the baseball area and had a refurb done very recently!we couldn't fault the accommodation the extra Bathroom downstairs is a godsend when you are sharing with 3 family females!! ;0) The renovations they have done here are amazing!! the lazy river is nice the pool is warm but for us the gigantic hot tub wins hands down! you could fit 20-25 people in there and it is hot!! Top tip Cici's Pizza is next to the complex not bad for the price and even cheaper if you ask about residents cards!! the best eats we had we're over in the publix lot at Smokey bones Another tip sign up to their E-mails before you go and make some great savings when you eat there! Over all we would be more than happy to return to Fantasy world villas and would reccomend it to all! the only negative thing i have to say is the phone calls about doing a tour (Time share) we said no thankyou but for two days the phone rang early in the morning till i asked them to take us off of the list (which they did) So thumbs up Fantasy world resort oh... and forgot to mention the use of free computers in their activity room ideal for printing boarding passes, tickets,dinner reservations ect.Am sure we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “New and improved! Good before, now even better.”
Reviews.Author: Fazerdude
Reviews.Content: Returned on 1st November from 2 weeks at Fantasy Villa's. Our 11th stay here since 2000, and it is better than ever, mainly due to the amazing new pool complex. You could not wish for anything better from the pool area/recreation building. I aren't going to go into detail here, as I have reviewed it before at length, but just felt I had to say that this resort is fantastic value. It's not the Hilton, but at £50 per night, you will not get better. For this standard elsewhere, could be up to £150 per night. Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “great locations”
Reviews.Author: bestbaby1
Reviews.Content: We checked into our villa. Though it says for 6 we found the space a little tight. One b/r queen bed, one with two twins and a pull out sofa. Our comparison is with the Westgate lakes and the units there are alot larger...also offered alot more towels etc.The unit was clean though lots of bugs around. The new waterpark is great though small...best feature the zero entry pool is heated and the hot tub the perfect temp!! Oh nice fire pit area by the hot tubs also The locations though is perfect for visiting the attractions in the area. I think next time we would go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “nice-cheap place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Jose A
Reviews.Content: Everything was like they said, the villas were in good shape, really calm place for relax after a exhausting day.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool”
Reviews.Author: bookwormbird
Reviews.Content: The newly completed pool and waterslide were beautiful and fun although we wished the waterslides were open longer hours. They said it was new and they were still working out some issues with lighting at night. The location was perfect for us: close to food, grocery stores and popular attractions, easy to find and return to at night. Olive Garden was walking distance away. The staff was pleasant but we were a little surprised that daily housekeeping service was not included. Maybe this is standard when renting a condo. The condo was was clean and pretty well maintained. However, some areas of the condo were in need of updating - apparently on-going at this time. The kitchen supplies were a little lacking if full meal preparation were planned. However, overall, we were happy with the accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Choice”
Reviews.Author: Dawn W
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed here in October and were extremely pleased with the whole experience. We didnt get off to a good start as we were allocated accomodation that somebody else was already staying in but this was soon sorted and we were allocated a more suitable location in our minds. It was clean and comfortable and was very roomy for 2 adults and 3 teenagers with more than enough equipment from kitchen utensils and numerous towels provided. The main pool area was fantastic but we used the smaller pool nearer to the 192 and had this to ourselves the majority of the time. The location was great to reach Disney and Universal all in 30 minutes or less. Good varied restaurants are all in easy reach and I would especially recommend the Olive Garden which is walking distance. On the whole I would recommend Fantasy World to anybody who wants excellent quality value for money accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: FairyTale68
Reviews.Content: Everything went just ok, when our family stayed st Fantasy World Club Villas. The condo was spacious and our kids just loved to have a room of their own. FCW Villas are quite close to everything - and there were a nice, relaxed atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS!”
Reviews.Author: Deirdre R
Reviews.Content: BED BUGS!!!! Need I say more. I was told that the sniffing dog must not have gotten to this unit yet. Thank goodness they were only in one bed. It took forever for them to switch our unit, I was so disgusted. Our first morning there to wake up to a bug crawling across the pillow down the back of the bed. Some one came to see and said "yep, those are bed bugs." He flipped all mattresses in the other rooms and showed us that there were no bugs except for the one single mattress in the other room. We washed all our clothing in hot water while we were there and once we arrived home we did not even bring the luggage back in the house. Perfect timing, the garbage truck arrived and all was sent bye bye. NEVER AGAIN!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis of Relaxation and Peace.”
Reviews.Author: Spotswood
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Fantasy world on 2 previous occasions, and I look forward to doing so again. indeed I would go there today if I could afford it (Recently unemployed). I was last there in November 2009 for two weeks, and we were in the Seaworld court section (both times). The staff have always been helpful, and the Town house/Villa was perfect for our needs as there were 5 in our party. a full size Villa elsewhere would have been too big and costly, and a hotel would have had to supply us with 2 rooms (costly by comparison). I understand that a lot of money has been spent recently improving the pool area and putting in slides etc. The hot tub is great for my aches and pains, as I am 47 and do a manual job. The bar is great and the surrounding area is full of restaurants and shops. Highway 192 is right next to the resort, and access is easy to Disney and International Drive. Only one word of warning, on our most recent visit to Fantasy world club villas we must have left our vehicle unlocked overnight outside our villa by mistake, and an opportunist tried all the doors during the night as the next morning the doors were open slightly, and the glovebox was open. Fortunately there was nothing in the vehicle to steal. So just make sure you lock your vehicle.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Travelcat131983
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Fantasy World Club Villas with another couple for 2 weeks and this place was ideal. The 2 bedrooms gave us plenty of space and the kitchen and living space came in very handy. The whole condo was spotlessly clean (no bedbugs in sight) and was equipped with everything you need. Don't expect maid service, but there is a dishwasher and a washer/dryer if you wish to use them. The Pool area (recently refurbished) had a great pool, water slides, jacuzzis and a lazy river, perfect for our one relaxing day off from the Parks. The pool was open til 11pm too so it was great to have a swim after a long sticky day walking! It's no longer than 15 mins drive to all the parks (Disney, Seaworld and Universal) and ample parking. There is a huge Walmart around the corner and tons of restaurants nearby.I would defiantly stay here again if in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: 474marie
Reviews.Content: found staff very friendly both in reception and the bar recieved good advice on taxi services and was even booked reliable taxi by reception . we have already booked to stay again next year and are looking forward to seeing the new pool improvements

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: mitraveler1234
Reviews.Content: Our past couple trips to FL we have stayed here. Lots of room, clean and always expanding and improving! :)

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOLIDAY EVER”
Reviews.Author: Karen W
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from our Orlando Holiday, to be honest if you are visiting the theme parks you don't spend much time in the Villa, we had no problems as all with out villa, large kitchen (no cooking done though) comfortable furniture, must have air-con, down stairs wc + shower, the bedrooms were a good size ample storage, and the family bathroom with shower, you also had a washing machine + tumbler drier, which did sound a bit like Concorde taking off at times. Over all if I go back to Orlando I would stay there. Loads of places to eat out we like TJI Friday's and the Olive Garden. Fantasy World Villa's are central for the Parks and close to lots of restuarants. +

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: Floridabeachbum11
Reviews.Content: We were given a newly renovated unit that was beautiful. Granite in kitchen and baths, new furniture and very clean. The views from the back of the units definitely vary. We looked out over a large ugly white building...at least it was quiet with no pool noise. The king bed in the master was actually 2 twins put together which was a little disappointing. Excellent location for the theme parks. New water park area looks awesome but is still about a month away from completion. We will definitely return when that is done!

Reviews.Title: “Very peaceful place close to everything!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kharr33
Reviews.Content: I have to say I was very pleased with our stay. I read the comments and thought there had to be a catch. Everything is close by the rooms were clean it was just a all around comftorable stay. I was a bit disappointed because the water park was closed but there were two other pools there which was just what we needed. The only problem we had was they shorted us a few things on the inventory sheet but they had no problem at all bringing us what we needed. Would defiently return in the future =)=)=)

Reviews.Title: “If your into Waterbugs and rude/nonresponsive staff...this is the place for you!”
Reviews.Author: AntNSus
Reviews.Content: What can I say? The other reviewers who mentioned the univited visitors and rude and unattentive staff were spot on. My family and I stayed at the "resort" from July 30-August 6 and the accomodations were the lowlight of our otherwise amazing vacation! Check-in- We arrived right on time for check-in and were greeted by a line that nearly extended past the front entrance. About 7 people were in front of us and, although there were three representatives at the front desk, it took nearly an hour for us to get keys to the unit. When i finally approached the desk, I was appalled by the condition of the front desk (littered with paperwork including personal information of guests, like credit card numbers) and the unprofessional appearance of the staff (one particular lady had holes in her dirty polo that was branded with the resort's logo...yuck). Getting settled in- Upon entering our unit, we were greeted with a wonderfully toasty room. The temperature, according to the thermostat was a sweltering 78 degrees ( it felt warmer). I adjusted the thermostat to cool the room and continued unpacking the cars. There were four adults and three small children staying together so, needless to say, it was important that we get the room to cool. Speaking of the kids, before leaving for dinner, we called the front desk and asked if they had any cribs available. The maintenance crew brought over two play yards that appeared to have survived Chernobyl. These things were GROSS with all kinds on nasty stains all over. The wives began wiping down the play yards and they went through nearly an entire container of clorox wipes just getting out the major funk...I can't believe we let our kids sleep in those things. Nevertheless, we were thankful that they could accomodate our request and we left for dinner. We returned to the unit around 10pm and surprise surprise, the room was as hot as it was when we left. I placed a call to the front desk and was told that it was too late and there were no maintenance workers available (but wait, isn't this place a "resort"?). In all fairness, they did say that someone would be availabe at 6am and they actually did call at 6am (i was a bit hung over so told them I'd call back once we were all awake). I called the front desk at 9am and asked them to come, by this point, we realized that only one small burner on the stove was working and that, adjacent to the closet with the air conditioner, the bottom step was saturated with water. Making breakfast was interesting with one burner. I called again at 9:30am, and after holding for ten minutes was greeted by a rep who picked up the phone and said "they aren't there yet?". No they still had not come. Another call at 9:45 and yet another call at 10:30...still no maintenance. My final call at 10:50am was a rough call, needless to say, i was probably less than warm. The maintenance man showed up 2 hours and 12 minutes after our first call at 9:00am...UNACCEPTABLE BY ANY STANDARDS. The maintenance man apologized for the wait and informed us that he was the only maintenance man on staff...a "resort"??? The worker had to leave and get a shop vac to suck up all the water that had leaked in the closet from the faulty AC and promised that a technician would RETURN to charge the AC. He attempted to fix the burners and was successful with 2 of the 3. Visitors- our second evening was free of all the not-so-luxurious amenities of our first night but did include a visit from some very healthy and fast waterbugs. For those unfamiliar with the term, a waterbug is the equivalent of a cockroach on a steroids regimen, fully grown and fast as heck. My cousin and I hunted him down and smashed him. Towels- plan on bringing your own. We soiled the towels that were in the unit and requested a fresh supply. We were told that we would have to pay $10. Not great news but, at this point, whatever. We asked for the towels and had to wait, yes wait, another 2.5 hours for someone to show up with a bag of towels. And no, there weren't even enough towels for all that were in the unit. All in all, i would never stay here again. The luxury of a kitchen to work out of (especially when you travel with small children) is not worth the inconvenience of staying at a place that is obviously not managed adequately. The management and staff need to step up their game if they hope to compete with the countless options that available and superior. In closing, the only thing that resembled a resort was the word resort used in the name. This fantasy world was more of a nightmare than anything. Steer clear!!!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and clean place to stay”
Reviews.Author: GeorginaJoyce
Reviews.Content: We stayed with family and friends for two nights at the end of our cruise. Each place was clean and spacious and very sufficient for our needs. It was nice to lots of space for 10 of us in two condos. The staff was very helpful. We made use of the free bus transportation to Disney World Epcot Centre. The pool and facility were also great. We would definitely stay here again. The area was under construction for expansion, so I'm sure it will only get better.

Reviews.Title: “Cockroaches and rude staff”
Reviews.Author: NikNak79
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this review prior to composing a letter to the company that runs this establishment but will keep it brief. We paid $550 for 5 nights, for which we could have got a nice hotel room somewhere else in the area, but we liked the idea of a house where we could come and go. The member of staff who checked me in was very rude, looked at my reservation ticket (through AAA) and asked me if I had anything else, when I said no this was what it said to print and hand in and asked if it would be okay she grumbled 'we'll see' and then continued checking me in with no conversation, eye contact or (to be quite frank) manners. The villa itself was nice, we were able to cook, do laundry, park easily and lock our personal things in the safe but we had a number of small (baby?) cockroaches crawling around the bathroom floor and kitchen (floor and cupboards). I'd say we killed at least 4 of these each day we were there. One day there was rain and we came home to find two HUGE roaches crawling round the kitchen and bathroom (at least 2 inches long). We managed to catch them in glasses and dispose of them outside but it was too late to contact the front desk about this. We had an early start the following day so plugged up all the drains and blocked any holes in the tiling and thankfully came back to just a few small bugs. On checkout the following day I handed my keys to the representative on the desk and said to her that there were a number of cockroaches in the villa and it might need someone looking at it - I got no response, she continued typing on her computer. So I asked her 'did you hear me? about the roaches?' She glanced up and replied 'yes' and then continued typing. This irritated me and I left the complex fuming and determined to lodge a complaint about the customer service I received on my two dealings with the front desk. Overall I would say stay here but the minute you see a bug speak to them and have them come and sort it ... you really don't get any thanks for just getting on with it and not complaining. On another note there looks like there will be a fab pool complex when it is finished up, although I would be surprised if it is in August 2011 as stated.

Reviews.Title: “This could have been a good review”
Reviews.Author: ninner
Reviews.Content: Our stay was an overall positive experience, but there were certain significant issues. First off all though, let me say that the facility itself was a positive. I had touched based about a week before our arrival and asked for an updated unit. Our request, although not guaranteed, was granted. Our villa for the most part was clean and comfortable. We had a nice quiet unit near the back of the property. A little ways from the pool, but nothing totally inconvenient. Our number one issue was with cockroaches. We had three of these visitors to our villa. I reported the issue to the front desk. They filled out a form and told me they would inform maintenance immediately (I thought this meant that maintenance would be there immediately). An hour and a half later I phoned the front desk and they informed me that maintenance does not tell them when they will deal with an issue but they told me that they would check on it again. TWO maintenance guys showed up with ONE can of spray 20 minutes later (still not sure what took two people, but there it is). Sprayed our bathroom, but did nothing to block the small hole where my husband saw one scurry off. We had no further issues, but I did not feel entirely comfortable knowing their point of access of still available. Another issue we had is that we checked in on the 13th and out of 23rd and there was no housekeeping services for the duration of our stay. The only time they showed up was early the day we were due to check out to see if we had left yet! One other minor complaint was the sketchy nature of the internet connection. Sometimes is was okay, other times it was downright useless. The best reception we got was outside the front door! We did not go on vacation to surf the net, however, so it was only a minor inconvenience, but an inconvenience nonetheless. Like I said, this could have been a good review, but the couple of issues we had were issues that impacted the quality of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “coming back next year!”
Reviews.Author: Tracy10111972
Reviews.Content: We have just arrived back from our hols on 21st june 2011, I had a wonderful holiday, fantasy surf is a little dated in some areas like the decor but it wasnt awful by a long way, it was extremely clean & comfortable with every thing you need away from home...washing machine & tumble dryer, microwave, iron & board to name a few. We had the added security of a safe in our villa & used it to place all out valuables in, which was very handy, Our villa overlooked the small pool which was fine with me, as we only had a short distance to walk to get there....we had construction of the new lazy river going on but I didnt even notice it as we were placed well away from any noise. The staff were more than helpful, any question or problem I had was dealt with quickly & efficiently. Some people are extemely fussy when they go on holiday, who cares whether you have a green carpet in your villa! your only there for a holiday! All in all dont expect to go there to find a 5* plush, state of the art villa coz you will be dissappointed, My villa looked exactly like the one on the fantasy world club villas website, so if you want to know what they look like check it out, if you want a comforable, clean base from which to rest your weary bones after going round the parks all day then this is the place! I will be going back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Want_my_opinion
Reviews.Content: My family (mother, sister and 2 year old daughter) stayed at Fantasy World Club Villas for a week. After checking all of the traveler's reviews, we decided to stay here because of it's close proximity to my work conference, Disney World and local attractions. This was a beautiful 2bed/2bath home. There is a flat screen TV and sofa bed in the living room. All of the amenities were as stated, 2 very nice pools, washer/dryer size was perfect for a vacay stay. So many activities to do daily (contests, arts & crafts, ice cream sundaes), like a retirement resort for all ages!!! It's located off of International Drive (RT192), where ALL OF YOUR SHOPPING AND DINING is done. Its about 12 miles from Disney and Downtown Disney. They offer shuttles to DW, but we wanted to stay later, so we drove. Book this villa, stock your fridge, and enjoy your new home away from home! Pros: everything! Cons: no discounts for Disney World

Reviews.Title: “Overall very nice for the entire family”
Reviews.Author: traveler053845
Reviews.Content: Other than the room wasn't ready at 4 pm when we kept checking every half hour, everything was great with this hotel. Everything was clean and the grounds were nice even with the construction going on. When that gets completed, this place will be even better to stay at. Like I said the only complaint I had was the slowness of cleaning our villa. They were cleaning it the first time we drove by at 2 pm and I think if we didn't keep asking, it would have taken longer yet. It is close to a lot of shopping centers and resturants. We drove to Magic Kingdom instead of using their shuttle sevice just because we wanted to be able to leave when we wanted. It was about 1 1/2 hour drive to Daytona Beach which was a nice break in our vacation. They were very helpful at the front desk by letting me use one of their computers in back when we needed to print out our boarding passes and both printers in the business center were not working.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Icemaiden10_11
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay here at fantasy world we enjoyed it so much we decided to return with extended members of family, whom we told how excellant the staff treated us and what a great stay we had We arrived at fantasy world at the end of march and what a disappointment it was when we arrived it was torrential rain which has nothing to do with staff, but when we arrived in the lobby the female reception member looked at us tutted as if we had inconvenienced her and rudely asked us for our paperwork then stood there and she was really uninterested in us beinbg there, she then gave us 1 key card we said there were two rooms again she tutted and said why didnt you say so, rolled here eyes and threw the other key card onto the reception desk she told us the numbers and gave us a map. When we arrived at the villas, they were very clean but had lightbulbs either not working or missing we did phone reception and they did send the maintenace man over straight away who dealt with the problems quickly. There was work going on and it will be wonderful when it is all finished,but it didnt disturb our holiday in any way, Apart from the rudeness and first impression it gave to my extended family we had a wonderful holiday and we found the villas to be perfect for our family and we will go again I just hope fantasy give their staff more training in customer training, the female needs to take lessons from jose who is a joy to deal with and nothing was too much trouble for him.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY! ROBBERY! Absolute nightmare!!”
Reviews.Author: artimes2
Reviews.Content: Our condo was broken into & burglarized in broad daylight!! We were at FantasySurf less than an hour, while our villa was being ransacked & our possessions stolen! One security guard for this entire complex?! who never showed up when called. Mgmt very unsupportive & indifferent. Noticed lack of attentive guest service upon arrival, poor condition of "resort", inconveniences including a major construction site on premises, uncomfortable at best. Worst timeshare exchange ever! Must say that the unit was very clean, before the break-in!

Reviews.Title: “great place, great value”
Reviews.Author: pksnee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the May off season and were very pleased to find such a good deal this close to Old town and Disney. We rented the room through Hotwire secret hotel deals for $54 a night and we were not required to pay a cleaning charge or resort fee upon arrival or checkout. We were given a 2 story, 2 bedroom unit that wasn't an updated one, but it was clean and modern enough for our needs. We were never approached about ownership programs and found that to be a big plus. We were pleased to witness housekeeping changing the bedspreads in between guests checking in and out of or neighboring unit (lots of hotels don't do this!) The pool has a friendly bartender that makes a good margarita and the restaurant will bring food down to the pool for you. They are undergoing a renovation in a separate area for a new pool and water feature, which is scheduled to be completed this summer (2011). The construction is confined to one area of the complex and I don't see it inconveniencing anyone, I know that we didn't hear it.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place. Sketchy area”
Reviews.Author: Thatgirl19
Reviews.Content: This place would be awesome if it was in another area. The condo is very clean and updated. As others have said don't plan on being close to the pool even though they have two. They are in the middle of building a new pool in the middle of everything so this will help. This area is full of closed business and has a ghetto feel to it. I will pay extra for a better area next time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location within easy reach of theme parks”
Reviews.Author: marshall_tony
Reviews.Content: Returned here on holiday for second year running staying 12 nights even though we knew extensive work was being carried out adding new pool, lazy river and other amenities etc which did not affect our enjoyment. Accommodation is a resort of small townhouses which were very clean with all modern appliances. The air conditioning was a must and very effective as this April was very hot! Only downside was having no snack bar on-site and I believe Fantasy World miss a trick here and would benefit greatly from having a good snack bar/restaurant. The location is only 25 minutes from Universal and the other Orlando/Disney main parks - also only just over 1 hour drive to Busch Gardens in Tampa (tip - we purchased fast pass tickets in advance but we found it fairly quiet and our fast pass tickets were not necessary).

Reviews.Title: “I can highly recommend this place!”
Reviews.Author: Nancy2445
Reviews.Content: I took my two grandaughters (11 and 14) for a Disney vacation, and we were very happy with Fantasy World Club Villas. For the price of a standard hotel room, we got two bedrooms, two bathrooms, a kitchen, washer and dryer, and TV's in every room. I thought it was a great savings. Target, Walmart, and Walgreens, plus plenty of restaurants are near by. We bought basic groceries at Target and ate breakfast and some dinners there. Having the washer/dryer was fantastic; it's very hot in Orlando in the summmer, and our clothes needed washing every day. The townhouse has plenty of towels (wash your own) and even provided beach towels for our day trip to Daytona Beach. One bathroom is normal sized with a tub. The second bath is not very convenient; it's downstairs and has only a small shower, but it was fine. I let the kids have the big bath and I took the small one downstairs. We loved having two bedrooms, and even the closet space was excellent. I would stay there again - it's a good value. Not luxury, but really pretty nice. Don't count on being near a swimming pool; they have two or three of them, but we were not close to any of them. There is no maid service unless you stay a week, but you don't need maid service; you can wash your own towels.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money!”
Reviews.Author: Jmon_10
Reviews.Content: Our unit was clean and recently renovated. We had no complaints about the unit itself and felt it was well worth the money. The resort is currently undergoing renovations so sleeping in was not an option. I'm not sure why they didn't renovate one "court" at a time and opted to do several units on each court at once. The pools were small and not very close to our unit, however they are building a new larger pool with lazy river that should be completed this summer. There were two concierge that helped us plan our days and rent a car. They were both fantastic, especially David. The resort was within walking distance to several restaurants and a grocery store. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: klambeth82
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled with our two children (ages 2 & 6) and my 18 year old brother, we arrived at around 11:30 p.m and check in went smoothly. All of the staff were friendly and courteous. There was construction going on right near our villa but it was never a problem. The Villa was wonderful!!! Plenty of towels, everything you would need in the kitchen, stainless steel appliances, flat screen tvs, a dvd player, washer/dryer.... and the list goes on. My husband and brother loved the fact that it had the screened in back porch that they could smoke on, instead of having to walk a mile to find a designated smoking area like you do at most hotels. There was plenty of room for all 5 of us. The pool was great (we only went to the heated one), it had a bar and the bartenders were great (they have fantastic strawberry daquiris), they have happy hour daily, and even had poolside Karoeke while we were there. Oh, and the shuttles to Disney were great, never crowded. There is definitley something for everyone at this resort... go you will love it :)

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: johnbugby
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Fla. My wife, my grandaughter (13) and myself. Fantasy World was great. No complaints. Staff was just great, very freindly and helpful with all our requests.Liked it better than some big time hotel .Just felt like being at home. Downstairs bathroom was a little small, but I was able to use the shower stall, and I weigh 275. Area was great, convienient to everything. Only problem was the weather, a little to cool. My grandaughter didn't get a chance to swim although one of the two pools was heated.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: MemoRoberts
Reviews.Content: Overall hotel is average, but kind of old. I’ll think that you can get better deals. Reviews of this hotel are too high. Best thing about staying here is the discount you get for the Fantasy Surf Attraction ( http://ultimateindoorwave.com/) that’s close to the resort. Try it´s 100% fun!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and great condo!!”
Reviews.Author: michiganmmt
Reviews.Content: For the price and accommodations you cant beat this place. Very friendly staff, attend to everything, nice computer in lobby, new kitchens and screened in porches with new furniture. Very roomy two bedroom, close to all shopping and both universal and disney. Only problem was that wireless internet didnt have strong enough signal at my condo so I had to go to lobby but we werent there to do business so that was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the price”
Reviews.Author: monster00
Reviews.Content: Considering that we only used the place for sleeping and eating breakfast, the price during the off-season was a real bargain. It's far from luxurious, but it was clean, had everything we needed (has full kitchen with 2 bedrooms and two full baths) and was close (15 - 20 minutes) to the major theme parks. I would stay here again. Cons: there should be more shelf space in the bathrooms and the dresser drawers are too shallow to be of much use. Also, the light bulbs in the bedroom lamps are too dim to read by.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: Heloise
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fantasy World Villas over the Christmas break, for one week. We booked through Hotwire and got a deal for a two bedroom, two floor condo and a Mazda 3 car for $150.00 per night. This is a good place to stay, but silly little things let it down: The refrigerator was antiquated and noisy. There was no ice maker and the shelves were badly tarnished. The patio door was impossible to open and close and the coffee maker was broken and took 25 minutes to make a pot. This was reported to reception. The door was fixed but the coffee maker was not. On our departure, December 29th, the receptionist showed absolutely no interest in the coffee maker and did not thank us for our stay and was pretty unhelpful. The reception staff and maintenance people are in dire need of training. This is a shame because the condo itself is really nice. It was very good value and peaceful. The walls between the condos are thick enough that you do not hear the neighbors. There was also a washer and dryer in the condo which is very convenient. We would stay here again but would hope that the owners would do something about the reception and maintenance staff. The location is excellent for visiting Disney World, Universal Studios, etc. The villas are just down the road from a Publix supermarket, restaurants as well as a Wal-Mart supercenter. Try and avoid using Interstate 4 as it gets really busy. The back roads are quicker.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait to Return”
Reviews.Author: helena-jo
Reviews.Content: After our airport shuttle bus dropped us off at our "supposed" accommodation quite late at night, we were dismayed to discover that we were, in fact, at the wrong place! The receptionist there phoned Fantasy Suites who, immediately, sent an employee over to collect us. Due to the size of his car and the size of our luggage, he made three trips to get us to our correct location! On the third trip, he came to reception to find out the unit number and drove my son and the remaining luggage to the actual unit!! This was the nature of the rest of our stay - nothing was too much trouble and the staff were prepared to go the extra mile to assist us with ANYTHING we needed from helping us with light switches which we couldn't figure out on arrival (and then following the visit of the maintenance man by a phone call from reception to ensure that our needs were met!) to supplying us with bandaids, more hair shampoo, laundry powder. whatever we needed. It was service with a smile every time! There were many features we loved about this resort - the impeccably clean. well designed and very well equipped units with EVERYTHING you could possibly need for a holiday, the very reliable shuttle service to Disneyworld and Universal Studios, the incredibly fast delivery service and reasonably priced food from the local fast food business, , the 24 hour coffee availability at reception and the well set-up business centre where you could get onto the internet so fast and print out you requirements.Being winter time, we did not venture to the pools but it seems that these would be a huge drawcard in the summer months especially with the new surf ride which is so much cheaper to ride if you are staying at the complex. Most of all, however, we were impressed with the professional, friendly and helpful staff who ensured that we had a really enjoyable and memorable time during our stay. Being from Australia, Orlando was a very long way from home for us but the staff at Fantasy World definitely ensured that we were staying in a "home away from home"!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: darrellmartin11
Reviews.Content: We didnot arrive until 2 am, it was very easy to find ( right of International Drive), staff was very helpfull at the early hour. Our villa was very clean and supplied (dish detergent, liquid for dish washer, garbage bags, etc). Bed very comfortable,sheets smelled nice and clean, bathroom had everyhting and more.
